evidence: Load raw data from a CSV file. – This indicates the initial data loading step.
Remove duplicate records from the dataset. – This is a data cleaning step, which is part of preprocessing.
Create a new feature by calculating the price per unit. – This is a clear example of creating new predictive features.
Save the processed data to a Parquet file. – This indicates the completion of the feature engineering step.
Select specific features and the label for the model. – This is a direct indication of feature selection.
Split the data into training and testing sets. – This is part of preparing the data for modeling, often included in feature selection.
Train a RandomForestClassifier using the training data. – This is the model training step.
Save the trained model to a file. – This indicates the completion of the model training process.
Make predictions using the trained model. – This is part of the model scoring process.
Calculate the accuracy of the model. – This is a key part of model evaluation.
Save the evaluation results to a text file. – This indicates the completion of the model evaluation process.
Model Evaluation.why_separate: Each identified component has a distinct function in the ML workflow and does not overlap with the others. For example, data preprocessing (Lines 1-10) is separate from feature engineering (Lines 11-14) because preprocessing involves cleaning the data, while feature engineering involves creating new features. Similarly, model training (Lines 34-40) is distinct from model evaluation (Lines 41-55) because training involves fitting the model, while evaluation involves assessing its performance.
